summary: Inspired by the classic RPG games, Identify Item requires you to identify the enchantments on your equipment in order to get full use out of them!
descriptionHtml:
[color=orange]A Nexus-only mod.[/color]
Requirements: The latest version of Skyrim.

=================
= What This Does =
=================
Identify Item makes it to where you have to identify equipment in order to get full use out of them. Not identifying them means that the enchantments are weaker, and you don't even know what it does!

Does not currently add unidentified items for weapons or for Dragonborn.

To identify an item, drop it on the ground and activate it. A menu will pop up asking what you want to do with it. Your enchanting skill must be a certain level in order to identify the item. The better quality the item, the higher your skill must be. Successfully identifying an item will also give skill XP for enchanting. Of course, not everyone was meant to be an enchanter, so some wizards have scrolls to sell....

========================
= Notes and Compatibility =
========================
In an attempt to maintain compatibility with mods that change armor values, I decided to set the Unidentified items to use the base armor as template armor. As a consequence, Unidentified items can be disenchanted.

This mod alters a lot of leveled lists (just armor, clothing, and jewelry) and may be incompatible with other mods that do the same. For a full list of everything changed, see the ReadMe.
Another consequence is that merchants also sell unidentified items at lower prices.


Constructive feedback and ideas is always appreciated!
author: Eccentric Team

files.name: Identify Item v1-1
files.changelogHtml:
Changed item values so that merchants no longer sell them for dirt cheap (oops)
Lowered skill gain for identifying items

files.name: Identify Item v1-2
files.changelogHtml:
Lowered skill gain again.
Added support for Dawnguard.

files.name: Identify Item - Dawnguard
files.changelogHtml:
Lowered skill gain again.
Added support for Dawnguard.
